reviews.review_title: Fun, campy film, not to be taken too seriously
reviews.content: I enjoyed this film, although I do not take it too seriously. I first saw this movie as a child and it brings back some happy memories for me, so I may be looking at it through rose colored glasses. However, I feel that this is a campy film that is just meant to be a fun musical, not a serious film. If you go into it looking for that type of movie, you will not be disappointed. The songs are catchy and enjoyable and it is interesting to see Michelle so young (and singing!). The story is basic, but watchable (musicals are normally not known for their deep story lines). Check out an older Maxwell Caufield in Empire Records as a semi washed-up star (that's his character, not a personal comment!). All in all, this movie can be a good time if you are looking for a fun, campy musical, or if you just happen to be flipping the channels at 3AM.

Had it not been called Grease 2, it would have been rated much higher. The songs are fairly catchy, and it was Michelle Pfeiffer's first screen role and she does fairly well at it.Maxwell Caulfield makes a fair lead, although somehow lacks the "zazz" that Danny (Travolta) Zucco had in the first film, I know the final scenes where he is dressed in leather definitely appeals to many ladies (and men!).It's fair... good Sunday afternoon or Boxing day fodder.

I thought Grease 2 was pretty funny (in a corny way), the T-Birds are portrayed as slightly geeky & stupid. This is noticeable in the way they speak, 'D.E.D, dead' is a personal favourite of mine. The songs are pretty catchy & if you try and detach yourself from the 'outstanding' original you might actually enjoy the film. It's a silly, fun, harmless film that if all else fails, will make you cringe with laughter. Hay it's not a patch on the original but give the film a break. 'Gentleman, Start Your Engines!'

This movie is definitely one of the best sequels that I have ever seen! From start to finish it is packed with songs that will get stuck in your head and make you want to get up and start dancing. It is a true musical and definite credit to it's "father-movie", Grease. The story follows the same Grease plot, but with a little twist that's a nice change. All of the actors/actresses are magnificent, very believable. There is also that truth to the era/decade that the movie takes place. It is captured very well. If you loved the first movie, you will love the second. And I highly recommend to anyone that if you have seen Grease, go Grease 2! You'll be a fan from the second the movie starts.

To be she seemed out of place and I thought that Maxwell Caulfield and Adrian Zmed were fantastic as with the other cast, yet I thought the movie may have been more of a hit with a different leading lady. I loved the dancing and thought all the actors, except for Stephanie played by Michelle Pfeiffer, were convincing in their roles and gave great performances. reviews.review_title: One of my Favorite coming of age stories of all times.
reviews.content: This movie is wonderful, nostalgic and fun. It's not Grease which was heavily influenced or set in the 50s. The movie exist in the Grease Universe but it's more 80s than 50s. Michael ready to excel academically at a new school in a new country became smitten by the cool hot girl.

I feel that Grease 2, while it is not of the same caliber as the original, Grease, is still a good movie. There were mistakes, I will agree, but overall, it was good. Michele Pfeiffer is an excellent actress and no one else could have played Stephanie Zinone.. Maxwell Caulfield played Michael Carrington as well as he could considering he was given little to work with. I have a collection of "bad" movies and this one is definitely NOT in that group. I won't say that this is one of the best movies/musicals I have ever seen but it is a far cry from the worst. Some of the songs were more than cheesy but overall it got the point across... A person also has to take into consideration that this was the first major role for several of the actors. For anyone expecting it to be a "remake" of Grease, it is a "disappointment, but for someone to be expecting fresh new faces and funny punch lines, this is great.

reviews.review_title: I don't know about everybody else, but GREASE 2 rocks!!!!
reviews.content: I don't know why people have a cow over sequels. Sure they are not always great or even good, but to just toss aside a perfectly good movie because it didn't contain the original characters is a bit over the top. What do people expect, John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John to play high school sweethearts in their 30s? I think not. The director, writers, and producers gave enough background information in the beginning of the movie to orient new watchers that if you hadn't seen Grease (which I love) you weren't completely lost. They included the T-Birds, Pink Ladies, the principals, and even "Crater Face"-you have to give them credit for putting together an excellent sequel. People who thought that Grease 2 sucked, I respect your opinions, I just totally disagree with some of the reasoning posted on this site for saying it sucked.
